metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: When selecting records from a table, you can filter the selection by using the "WHERE" statement:
content.html: When selecting records from a table, you can filter the selection by using the "WHERE" statement:

content.code_html:
var mysql = require('mysql');

var con = mysql.createConnection({
  host: "localhost",
  user: "yourusername",
  password: "yourpassword",
  database: "mydb"
});

con.connect(function(err) {
  if (err) throw err;
  con.query("SELECT * FROM customers WHERE address = 'Park Lane 38'", function (err, result) {
    if (err) throw err;
    console.log(result);
  });
});

content.text: Save the code above in a file called "demo_db_where.js" and run the file:
content.html: Save the code above in a file called "demo_db_where.js" and run the file:

content.code_html: C:\Users\Your Name>node demo_db_where.js

content.text: Which will give you this result:

content.code_html:
[
  { id: 11, name: 'Ben', address: 'Park Lane 38'}
]

content.text: You can also select the records that starts, includes, or ends with a given letter or phrase.
content.html: You can also select the records that starts, includes, or ends with a given letter or phrase.

content.text: Use the '%' wildcard to represent zero, one or multiple characters:
content.html: Use the '%' wildcard to represent zero, one or multiple characters:

content.code_html:
var mysql = require('mysql');

var con = mysql.createConnection({
  host: "localhost",
  user: "yourusername",
  password: "yourpassword",
  database: "mydb"
});

con.connect(function(err) {
  if (err) throw err;
  con.query("SELECT * FROM customers WHERE address LIKE 'S%'", function (err, result) {
    if (err) throw err;
    console.log(result);
  });
});

content.text: Save the code above in a file called "demo_db_where_s.js" and run the file:
content.html: Save the code above in a file called "demo_db_where_s.js" and run the file:

content.code_html: C:\Users\Your Name>node demo_db_where_s.js

content.text: Which will give you this result:

content.code_html:
[
  { id: 8, name: 'Richard', address: 'Sky st 331'},
  { id: 14, name: 'Viola', address: 'Sideway 1633'}
]

content.text: When query values are variables provided by the user, you should escape the values.
content.html: When query values are variables provided by the user, you should escape the values.

content.text: This is to prevent SQL injections, which is a common web hacking technique to destroy or misuse your database.
content.html: This is to prevent SQL injections, which is a common web hacking technique to destroy or misuse your database.

content.text: The MySQL module has methods to escape query values:
content.html: The MySQL module has methods to escape query values:

content.code_html:
var adr = 'Mountain 21';
var sql = 'SELECT * FROM customers WHERE address = ' + mysql.escape(adr);
con.query(sql, function (err, result) {
  if (err) throw err;
  console.log(result);
});

content.text: You can also use a ? as a placeholder for the values you want to escape.
content.html: You can also use a ? as a placeholder for the values you want to escape.

content.text: In this case, the variable is sent as the second parameter in the query() method:
content.html: In this case, the variable is sent as the second parameter in the query() method:

content.code_html:
var adr = 'Mountain 21';
var sql = 'SELECT * FROM customers WHERE address = ?';
con.query(sql, [adr], function (err, result) {
  if (err) throw err;
  console.log(result);
});

content.text: If you have multiple placeholders, the array contains multiple values, in that order:
content.html: If you have multiple placeholders, the array contains multiple values, in that order:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
'SELECT * FROM 
  customers WHERE name = ? OR address = ?'

syntax_highlighting.text:
'SELECT * FROM 
  customers WHERE name = ? OR address = ?'

content.code_html:
var name = 'Amy';
var adr = 'Mountain 21';
var sql = 'SELECT * FROM customers WHERE name = ? OR address = ?';
con.query(sql, [name, adr], function (err, result) {
  if (err) throw err;
  console.log(result);
});

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
'SELECT * FROM 
  customers WHERE name = ? OR address = ?'
